00027 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"

00029 #include "BLI_array.h"

00037 #define FACE_MARK   1
00038 #define FACE_ORIG   2
00039 #define FACE_NEW    4
00040 #define EDGE_MARK   1
00041 
00042 #define VERT_MARK   1
00043 
00044 static int UNUSED_FUNCTION(check_hole_in_region)(BMesh *bm, BMFace *f)
00045 {
00046     BMWalker regwalker;
00047     BMIter liter2;
00048     BMLoop *l2, *l3;
00049     BMFace *f2;
00050 
00051     /* checks if there are any unmarked boundary edges in the face regio */
00052 
00053     BMW_init(&regwalker, bm, BMW_ISLAND,
00054              BMW_MASK_NOP, BMW_MASK_NOP, FACE_MARK,
00055              BMW_FLAG_NOP,
00056              BMW_NIL_LAY);
00057 
00058     f2 = BMW_begin(&regwalker, f);
00059     for ( ; f2; f2 = BMW_step(&regwalker)) {
00060         l2 = BM_iter_new(&liter2, bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, f2);
00061         for ( ; l2; l2 = BM_iter_step(&liter2)) {
00062             l3 = l2->radial_next;
00063             if ( BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l3->f, FACE_MARK) !=
00064                  BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l2->f, FACE_MARK))
00065             {
00066                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l2->e, EDGE_MARK)) {
00067                     return FALSE;
00068                 }
00069             }
00070         }
00071     }
00072     BMW_end(&regwalker);
00073 
00074     return TRUE;
00075 }
00076 
00077 void bmo_dissolve_faces_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00078 {
00079     BMOIter oiter;
00080     BMFace *f, *f2 /* , *nf = NULL */;
00081     BLI_array_declare(faces);
00082     BLI_array_declare(regions);
00083     BMFace ***regions = NULL;
00084     BMFace **faces = NULL;
00085     BMWalker regwalker;
00086     int i;
00087 
00088     int use_verts = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_verts");
00089 
00090     if (use_verts) {
00091         /* tag verts that start out with only 2 edges,
00092          * don't remove these later */
00093         BMIter viter;
00094         BMVert *v;
00095 
00096         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &viter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00097             BMO_elem_flag_set(bm, v, VERT_MARK, (BM_vert_edge_count(v) != 2));
00098         }
00099     }
00100 
00101     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE, FACE_MARK);
00102     
00103     /* collect region */
00104     BMO_ITER (f, &oiter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00105 
00106         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_MARK)) {
00107             continue;
00108         }
00109 
00110         BLI_array_empty(faces);
00111         faces = NULL; /* forces different allocatio */
00112 
00113         BMW_init(&regwalker, bm, BMW_ISLAND,
00114                  BMW_MASK_NOP, BMW_MASK_NOP, FACE_MARK,
00115                  BMW_FLAG_NOP, /* no need to check BMW_FLAG_TEST_HIDDEN, faces are already marked by the bmo */
00116                  BMW_NIL_LAY);
00117 
00118         f2 = BMW_begin(&regwalker, f);
00119         for ( ; f2; f2 = BMW_step(&regwalker)) {
00120             BLI_array_append(faces, f2);
00121         }
00122         BMW_end(&regwalker);
00123         
00124         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(faces); i++) {
00125             f2 = faces[i];
00126             BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, f2, FACE_MARK);
00127             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f2, FACE_ORIG);
00128         }
00129 
00130         if (BMO_error_occurred(bm)) {
00131             BMO_error_clear(bm);
00132             BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_DISSOLVEFACES_FAILED, NULL);
00133             goto cleanup;
00134         }
00135         
00136         BLI_array_append(faces, NULL);
00137         BLI_array_append(regions, faces);
00138     }
00139     
00140     for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(regions); i++) {
00141         int tot = 0;
00142         
00143         faces = regions[i];
00144         if (!faces[0]) {
00145             BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_DISSOLVEFACES_FAILED,
00146                             "Could not find boundary of dissolve region");
00147             goto cleanup;
00148         }
00149         
00150         while (faces[tot])
00151             tot++;
00152         
00153         f = BM_faces_join(bm, faces, tot, TRUE);
00154         if (!f) {
00155             BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_DISSOLVEFACES_FAILED,
00156                             "Could not create merged face");
00157             goto cleanup;
00158         }
00159 
00160         /* if making the new face failed (e.g. overlapping test)
00161          * unmark the original faces for deletion */
00162         BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, f, FACE_ORIG);
00163         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, FACE_NEW);
00164 
00165     }
00166 
00167     BMO_op_callf(bm, "del geom=%ff context=%i", FACE_ORIG, DEL_FACES);
00168 
00169 
00170     if (use_verts) {
00171         BMIter viter;
00172         BMVert *v;
00173 
00174         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &viter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00175             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK)) {
00176                 if (BM_vert_edge_count(v) == 2) {
00177                     BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE);
00178                 }
00179             }
00180         }
00181     }
00182 
00183     if (BMO_error_occurred(bm)) {
00184         goto cleanup;
00185     }
00186 
00187     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "regionout", BM_FACE, FACE_NEW);
00188 
00189 cleanup:
00190     /* free/cleanup */
00191     for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(regions); i++) {
00192         if (regions[i]) MEM_freeN(regions[i]);
00193     }
00194 
00195     BLI_array_free(regions);
00196 }
00197 
00198 /* almost identical to dissolve edge, except it cleans up vertice */
00199 void bmo_dissolve_edgeloop_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00200 {
00201     /* BMOperator fop; */
00202     BMOIter oiter;
00203     BMIter iter;
00204     BMVert *v, **verts = NULL;
00205     BLI_array_declare(verts);
00206     BMEdge *e;
00207     BMFace *fa, *fb;
00208     int i;
00209 
00210 
00211     BMO_ITER (e, &oiter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00212         if (BM_edge_face_pair(e, &fa, &fb)) {
00213             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v1, VERT_MARK);
00214             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v2, VERT_MARK);
00215 
00216             /* BMESH_TODO - check on delaying edge removal since we may end up removing more then
00217              * one edge, and later referene a removed edge */
00218             BM_faces_join_pair(bm, fa, fb, e, TRUE);
00219         }
00220     }
00221 
00222     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00223         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK) && BM_vert_edge_count(v) == 2) {
00224             BLI_array_append(verts, v);
00225         }
00226     }
00227 
00228     /* clean up extreneous 2-valence vertice */
00229     for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(verts); i++) {
00230         if (verts[i]->e) {
00231             BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, verts[i]->e, verts[i], TRUE);
00232         }
00233     }
00234     
00235     BLI_array_free(verts);
00236 
00237     //BMO_op_initf(bm, &fop, "dissolve_faces faces=%ff", FACE_MARK);
00238     //BMO_op_exec(bm, &fop);
00239 
00240     //BMO_slot_copy(op, &fop, "regionout", "regionout");
00241 
00242     //BMO_op_finish(bm, &fop);
00243 }

00246 void bmo_dissolve_edges_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00247 {
00248     /* might want to make this an option or mode - campbell */
00249 
00250     /* BMOperator fop; */
00251     BMOIter eiter;
00252     BMEdge *e;
00253 
00254     BMIter viter;
00255     BMVert *v;
00256 
00257     int use_verts = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_verts");
00258 
00259     if (use_verts) {
00260         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &viter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00261             BMO_elem_flag_set(bm, v, VERT_MARK, (BM_vert_edge_count(v) != 2));
00262         }
00263     }
00264 
00265     BMO_ITER (e, &eiter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00266         BMFace *fa, *fb;
00267 
00268         if (BM_edge_face_pair(e, &fa, &fb)) {
00269 
00270             /* join faces */
00271 
00272             /* BMESH_TODO - check on delaying edge removal since we may end up removing more then
00273              * one edge, and later referene a removed edge */
00274             BM_faces_join_pair(bm, fa, fb, e, TRUE);
00275         }
00276     }
00277 
00278     if (use_verts) {
00279         BM_ITER_MESH (v, &viter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00280             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK)) {
00281                 if (BM_vert_edge_count(v) == 2) {
00282                     BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE);
00283                 }
00284             }
00285         }
00286     }
00287 }
00288 
00289 static int test_extra_verts(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v)
00290 {
00291     BMIter iter, liter, iter2, iter3;
00292     BMFace *f, *f2;
00293     BMLoop *l;
00294     BMEdge *e;
00295     int found;
00296 
00297     /* test faces around verts for verts that would be wrongly killed
00298      * by dissolve faces. */
00299     f = BM_iter_new(&iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_VERT, v);
00300     for ( ; f; f = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00301         l = BM_iter_new(&liter, bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, f);
00302         for ( ; l; l = BM_iter_step(&liter)) {
00303             if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, VERT_MARK)) {
00304                 /* if an edge around a vert is a boundary edge,
00305                  * then dissolve faces won't destroy it.
00306                  * also if it forms a boundary with one
00307                  * of the face region */
00308                 found = FALSE;
00309                 e = BM_iter_new(&iter2, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT, l->v);
00310                 for ( ; e; e = BM_iter_step(&iter2)) {
00311                     if (BM_edge_is_boundary(e)) {
00312                         found = TRUE;
00313                     }
00314                     f2 = BM_iter_new(&iter3, bm, BM_FACES_OF_EDGE, e);
00315                     for ( ; f2; f2 = BM_iter_step(&iter3)) {
00316                         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f2, FACE_MARK)) {
00317                             found = TRUE;
00318                             break;
00319                         }
00320                     }
00321                     if (found == TRUE) {
00322                         break;
00323                     }
00324                 }
00325                 if (found == FALSE) {
00326                     return FALSE;
00327                 }
00328             }
00329         }
00330     }
00331 
00332     return TRUE;
00333 }
00334 void bmo_dissolve_verts_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00335 {
00336     BMIter iter, fiter;
00337     BMVert *v;
00338     BMFace *f;
00339     /* int i; */
00340 
00341     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT, VERT_MARK);
00342     
00343     for (v = BM_iter_new(&iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH, NULL); v; v = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00344         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK)) {
00345             /* check if it's a two-valence ver */
00346             if (BM_vert_edge_count(v) == 2) {
00347 
00348                 /* collapse the ver */
00349                 /* previously the faces were joined, but collapsing between 2 edges
00350                  * gives some advantage/difference in using vertex-dissolve over edge-dissolve */
00351 #if 0
00352                 BM_vert_collapse_faces(bm, v->e, v, 1.0f, TRUE, TRUE);
00353 #else
00354                 BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE);
00355 #endif
00356 
00357                 continue;
00358             }
00359 
00360             f = BM_iter_new(&fiter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_VERT, v);
00361             for ( ; f; f = BM_iter_step(&fiter)) {
00362                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, FACE_ORIG);
00363                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, FACE_MARK);
00364             }
00365             
00366             /* check if our additions to the input to face dissolve
00367              * will destroy nonmarked vertices. */
00368             if (!test_extra_verts(bm, v)) {
00369                 f = BM_iter_new(&fiter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_VERT, v);
00370                 for ( ; f; f = BM_iter_step(&fiter)) {
00371                     if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_ORIG)) {
00372                         BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, f, FACE_MARK);
00373                         BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, f, FACE_ORIG);
00374                     }
00375                 }
00376             }
00377             else {
00378                 f = BM_iter_new(&fiter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_VERT, v);
00379                 for ( ; f; f = BM_iter_step(&fiter)) {
00380                     BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, f, FACE_ORIG);
00381                 }
00382             }
00383         }
00384     }
00385 
00386     BMO_op_callf(bm, "dissolve_faces faces=%ff", FACE_MARK);
00387     if (BMO_error_occurred(bm)) {
00388         const char *msg;
00389 
00390         BMO_error_get(bm, &msg, NULL);
00391         BMO_error_clear(bm);
00392         BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_DISSOLVEVERTS_FAILED, msg);
00393     }
00394     
00395     /* clean up any remainin */
00396     for (v = BM_iter_new(&iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH, NULL); v; v = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00397         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, VERT_MARK)) {
00398             if (!BM_vert_dissolve(bm, v)) {
00399                 BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_DISSOLVEVERTS_FAILED, NULL);
00400                 return;
00401             }
00402         }
00403     }
00404 
00405 }

00407 /* this code is for cleaning up two-edged faces, it shall become
00408  * it's own function one day */
00409 #if 0
00410 void dummy_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00411 {
00412     {
00413         /* clean up two-edged face */
00414         /* basic idea is to keep joining 2-edged faces until their
00415          * gone.  this however relies on joining two 2-edged faces
00416          * together to work, which doesn't */
00417         found3 = 1;
00418         while (found3) {
00419             found3 = 0;
00420             for (f = BM_iter_new(&iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH, NULL); f; f = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00421                 if (!BM_face_validate(bm, f, stderr)) {
00422                     printf("error.\n");
00423                 }
00424 
00425                 if (f->len == 2) {
00426                     //this design relies on join faces working
00427                     //with two-edged faces properly.
00428                     //commenting this line disables the
00429                     //outermost loop.
00430                     //found3 = 1;
00431                     found2 = 0;
00432                     l = BM_iter_new(&liter, bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, f);
00433                     fe = l->e;
00434                     for ( ; l; l = BM_iter_step(&liter)) {
00435                         f2 = BM_iter_new(&fiter, bm,
00436                                 BM_FACES_OF_EDGE, l->e);
00437                         for ( ; f2; f2 = BM_iter_step(&fiter)) {
00438                             if (f2 != f) {
00439                                 BM_faces_join_pair(bm, f, f2, l->e);
00440                                 found2 = 1;
00441                                 break;
00442                             }
00443                         }
00444                         if (found2) break;
00445                     }
00446 
00447                     if (!found2) {
00448                         BM_face_kill(bm, f);
00449                         BM_edge_kill(bm, fe);
00450                     }
00451                 }
00452 #if 0
00453                 else if (f->len == 3) {
00454                     BMEdge *ed[3];
00455                     BMVert *vt[3];
00456                     BMLoop *lp[3];
00457                     int i = 0;
00458 
00459                     //check for duplicate edges
00460                     l = BM_iter_new(&liter, bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, f);
00461                     for ( ; l; l = BM_iter_step(&liter)) {
00462                         ed[i] = l->e;
00463                         lp[i] = l;
00464                         vt[i++] = l->v;
00465                     }
00466                     if (vt[0] == vt[1] || vt[0] == vt[2]) {
00467                         i += 1;
00468                     }
00469 #endif
00470             }
00471         }
00472         if (oldlen == len) break;
00473         oldlen = len;
00474     }
00475 }
00476 
00477 #endif
00478 
00479 /* Limited Dissolve */
00480 
00481 #define UNIT_TO_ANGLE DEG2RADF(90.0)
00482 #define ANGLE_TO_UNIT (1.0 / UNIT_TO_ANGLE)
00483 
00484 /* multiply vertex edge angle by face angle
00485  * this means we are not left with sharp corners between _almost_ planer faces
00486  * convert angles [0-PI/2] -> [0-1], multiply together, then convert back to radians. */
00487 float bm_vert_edge_face_angle(BMVert *v)
00488 {
00489     const float angle = BM_vert_calc_edge_angle(v);
00490     /* note: could be either edge, it doesn't matter */
00491     if (v->e && BM_edge_is_manifold(v->e)) {
00492         return ((angle * ANGLE_TO_UNIT) * (BM_edge_calc_face_angle(v->e) * ANGLE_TO_UNIT)) * UNIT_TO_ANGLE;
00493     }
00494     else {
00495         return angle;
00496     }
00497 }
00498 
00499 #undef UNIT_TO_ANGLE
00500 #undef ANGLE_TO_UNIT
00501 
00502 typedef struct DissolveElemWeight {
00503     BMHeader *ele;
00504     float weight;
00505 } DissolveElemWeight;
00506 
00507 static int dissolve_elem_cmp(const void *a1, const void *a2)
00508 {
00509     const struct DissolveElemWeight *d1 = a1, *d2 = a2;
00510 
00511     if      (d1->weight > d2->weight) return  1;
00512     else if (d1->weight < d2->weight) return -1;
00513     return 0;
00514 }
00515 
00516 void bmo_dissolve_limit_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00517 {
00518     BMOpSlot *einput = BMO_slot_get(op, "edges");
00519     BMOpSlot *vinput = BMO_slot_get(op, "verts");
00520     const float angle_max = (float)M_PI / 2.0f;
00521     const float angle_limit = minf(angle_max, BMO_slot_float_get(op, "angle_limit"));
00522     DissolveElemWeight *weight_elems = MEM_mallocN(MAX2(einput->len, vinput->len) *
00523                                                      sizeof(DissolveElemWeight), __func__);
00524     int i, tot_found;
00525 
00526     /* --- first edges --- */
00527 
00528     /* go through and split edge */
00529     for (i = 0, tot_found = 0; i < einput->len; i++) {
00530         BMEdge *e = ((BMEdge **)einput->data.p)[i];
00531         const float angle = BM_edge_calc_face_angle(e);
00532 
00533         if (angle < angle_limit) {
00534             tot_found++;
00535         }
00536         weight_elems[i].ele = (BMHeader *)e;
00537         weight_elems[i].weight = angle;
00538     }
00539 
00540     if (tot_found != 0) {
00541         qsort(weight_elems, einput->len, sizeof(DissolveElemWeight), dissolve_elem_cmp);
00542 
00543         for (i = 0; i < tot_found; i++) {
00544             BMEdge *e = (BMEdge *)weight_elems[i].ele;
00545 
00546             if (/* may have become non-manifold */
00547                 BM_edge_is_manifold(e) &&
00548                 /* check twice because cumulative effect could dissolve over angle limit */
00549                 (BM_edge_calc_face_angle(e) < angle_limit))
00550             {
00551                 BMFace *nf = BM_faces_join_pair(bm, e->l->f,
00552                                                 e->l->radial_next->f,
00553                                                 e,
00554                                                 FALSE); /* join faces */
00555 
00556                 /* there may be some errors, we don't mind, just move on */
00557                 if (nf) {
00558                     BM_face_normal_update(nf);
00559                 }
00560                 else {
00561                     BMO_error_clear(bm);
00562                 }
00563             }
00564         }
00565 
00566         /* remove all edges/verts left behind from dissolving */
00567         for (i = 0; i < einput->len; i++) {
00568             BMEdge *e = (BMEdge *)weight_elems[i].ele;
00569             if (BM_edge_is_wire(e)) {
00570                 BMVert *v1 = e->v1;
00571                 BMVert *v2 = e->v2;
00572                 BM_edge_kill(bm, e);
00573                 if (v1->e == NULL) BM_vert_kill(bm, v1);
00574                 if (v2->e == NULL) BM_vert_kill(bm, v2);
00575             }
00576         }
00577     }
00578 
00579     /* --- second verts --- */
00580     for (i = 0, tot_found = 0; i < vinput->len; i++) {
00581         BMVert *v = ((BMVert **)vinput->data.p)[i];
00582         const float angle = bm_vert_edge_face_angle(v);
00583 
00584         if (angle < angle_limit) {
00585             weight_elems[i].ele = (BMHeader *)v;
00586             weight_elems[i].weight = angle;
00587             tot_found++;
00588         }
00589         else {
00590             weight_elems[i].ele = NULL;
00591             weight_elems[i].weight = angle_max;
00592         }
00593     }
00594 
00595     if (tot_found != 0) {
00596         qsort(weight_elems, vinput->len, sizeof(DissolveElemWeight), dissolve_elem_cmp);
00597 
00598         for (i = 0; i < tot_found; i++) {
00599             BMVert *v = (BMVert *)weight_elems[i].ele;
00600             if (/* topology changes may cause this to be un-collapsable */
00601                 (BM_vert_edge_count(v) == 2) &&
00602                 /* check twice because cumulative effect could dissolve over angle limit */
00603                 bm_vert_edge_face_angle(v) < angle_limit)
00604             {
00605                 BMEdge *ne = BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE); /* join edges */
00606 
00607                 if (ne && ne->l) {
00608                     BM_edge_normals_update(ne);
00609                 }
00610             }
00611         }
00612     }
00613 
00614     MEM_freeN(weight_elems);
00615 }
